artefact: Marine works consent (England, Scotland and Wales)

artefact.overview: You need consent to carry out work that could be detrimental to the navigation of waters
artefact.licence_short_description: You need consent to carry out work that could be detrimental to the navigation of waters
artefact.licence_overview:
If you want to carry out work that could be detrimental to the navigation of waters, you must have consent from the Board of Trade.

Work detrimental to navigation could be:

- construction, alteration or improvement works on, under or over part of the seashore that lays below the level of mean high water springs
- depositing any objects or materials on such a seashore
- removing any object or material on seashore that lays below the level of mean low water springs

You may be required to provide plans or other information.

apply.introduction: Marine Scotland regulates the deposit of substances/articles in the sea within UK waters adjacent to Scotland. This is required under Part II of the Food and Environment Protection Act 1985. Materials should not be deposited permanently or temporarily below the tidal level of Mean High Water Springs without a FEPA licence.     Amongst others, licensable activities include:   sea disposal of dredgings    construction projects   installation of marine renewable devices
apply.description: Marine works consent - Application to undertake marine construction
